Considera a su negocio bastante rentable  por la demanda y precio elevado que tiene éste producto dejándole buenas ganancias. Por lo constarlo, lo que no le gusta es la informalidad del trabajo deseando en un futuro poder regularizar. Pero a pesar de todo, tiene planes de continuar con su negocio e implementar un taller de carpintería en sociedad con su yerno. Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además nos comenta sentirse  a gusto con su banco comunal pues  lo considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de trozas de madera, ósea tablones, buscando precios más bajos por su compra al contado y en volumen, así obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
55-year-old Víctor is a hard-working and determined man.  He is also cheerful and sociable, and has a great desire to make progress in life.  He is separated from his children's mother and lives in his own home together with his daughter, his son-in-law and his two grandchildren who he loves very much and who he spoils.

Víctor's business is buying and selling pieces of wood such as planks.  He acquires these in the port in his town from timber harvesters who arrive there and then sells them to sawmills or to buyers from other towns at reasonable prices.  This helps him grow his customer base.  He has been in this business for more than a year and, up to now, he has had the support of his son-in-law, with whom he shares the profits.  Víctor enjoys his business as it is his only source of income and he is able to work together with members of his family such as his son-in-law.  He considers his business to be fairly profitable because of the demand he has and the high price of this product, which makes him good profits.  What he does not like about his business is the informal nature of his work.  In the future he would like to make his business official.  However, in spite of everything, he has plans to continue working in his business and to set up a carpentry workshop in partnership with his son-in-law.

This will be Víctor's third loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive a small loan so that he can achieve his goals.  He tells us that he feels happy with his community bank because he considers it to be a united and supportive group.  He will invest the 2,000 soles he has requested in buying pieces of wood (planks).  He will look to obtain them for lower prices because he will be paying cash and buying in bulk.  This will make him more profits.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Janelis

texts.es: Janelis, de 22 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de progresar  salir adelante. Es conviviente con Leandro con quien comparte un negocio y es el padre de sus 03 hijos de 9, 7 y 5 años de edad a quienes quiere mucho. Juntos habitan cómodamente la casa de sus suegros en compañía de de los padres de su pareja. La actividad que realiza Janelis es la pesca y venta al por mayor de pescado fresco de  diversas especies. Para esta actividad cuenta con un pequeño bote pesquero la cual compró en sociedad con tres personas que son sus familiares. Iniciándose en esta nueva aventura. Se levantan muy de temprano y se dirigen al río Ucayali donde navegan buscando los mejores ejemplares. Comenta que se inició hace 02 años contando con la colaboración de su pareja quien la animo a invertir su capital ya que vieron que éste negocio es bastante rentable por las ganancias que  les deja. Viendo las dificultades económicas que atravesaba  por el aumento de los gastos de su familia se decidió  buscar alternativas de solución, y con motivación de su pareja de decidió por éste negocio, que le ha brindado las ganancias necesarias para poder solventar sus gastos. Por tanto tiene planes de continuar con su negocio e implementar  los accesorios necesarios para poder realizarlas con toda seguridad. Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP. Se siente contenta de saber que contará con el apoyo financiero para continuar avanzando con su negocio. Por tanto se compromete a pagar puntualmente las cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas solidarias y amables. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la pesca, como tramperas, redes, arpones y otros, buscando los mejores precios por sus compras al contado.
texts.en:
Janelis, 22, is a hard-working and diligent woman who really wants to get ahead.  She lives with Leandro, with whom she shares a business.  He is the father of their three beloved children, who are 5, 7, and 9.  They live comfortably together in her in-laws' house.  Janelis fishes and sells various species of fresh fish wholesale. She has a small fishing boat, which she bought together with three other relatives to start up this new venture.  They get up very early and drive to the Ucayali river, where they seek out the best spots.  She says that she started this work two years ago with the help of her partner, who encouraged her to invest her capital in it, since they saw that this was a good way to make money.  In light of the economic problems caused by the increase in costs to their family, she was looking for alternative solutions, and with the backing of her partner, she dedicated herself to this business, which has brought in the necessary income to cover their expenses.  Therefore, she wants to continue with this business and acquire the accessories needed to perform it with complete security.  

This will be her third loan with Kiva partner MFP.  She is happy that she can count on this financial support to keep going forward with her business. She promises to meet her payments punctually, just as she has done with her earlier loans.  She also says she feels comfortable with her community bank, since she knows all the members and considers them friendly and comradely.  With the money requested, she will invest in buying materials for fishing, such as traps, nets, and harpoons, seeking out the best prices for purchases by paying cash.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing, such as traps, nets, and harpoons.

loans.name: Katungu

texts.fr: La cliente Katungu est  entrepreneur, âgée de 46  ans, mariée, mère de 8 jeunes enfants et plusieurs petits fils. Son mari travaille dans une industrie locale artisanale de brasserie. Elle est  vendeuse de maïs. Il y a  20 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  17eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  dix tonnes de maïs, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et accroitre son entreprise et vivre le reste de sa vie en paix.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: This customer, Katungu, is a businesswoman who is 46 years old, married and mother to eight young children as well as several grandsons. Her husband works in a local artisanal brasserie and she sells corn. She has been carrying out these kinds of small income-generating activities for the past 20 years. Meanwhile, she has just been granted her 17th loan from Hekima. This new loan will be used by her to stock up with ten tons of corn, etc. She would in the future like to see her children grow up comfortably and expand her business as well as being able to live the rest of her life in peace. The customer thanks Hekima for its actions in favour of poor women who do not have access to classic banks.

loans.use: to pay for ten tons of corn

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: C9257  Ubumwe Group

texts.en:
Peace is thirty-three years old and married with two children between the ages of three and four years old.  Her business is well organized.  In her small shop she sells different goods including juice, water, milk etc.  Peace works from 5am until 10pm every day.  She employes two people to help her and they have one year's experience.  Peace is the president of this group which is called "C9257 Ubumwe" in the local language.  In the photo, she is the first person from the right. 

Peace has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to purchase soft drinks like milk, soda, juice etc to sell.  With the profits from the loan, she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks like sado, milk, water and juice to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, de 55 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, además de ser amable y cordial con las personas. Está casado con Graciela quien es ama de casa y madre de sus dos hijos William y Clarita de 20 y 18 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos están muy bien instalados en su propia casa que compraron con el fruto de sus ahorros. La actividad que realiza Carlos es la venta de pescados frescos, para eso se levanta muy de temprano en la madrugadas y se dirige al puerto más cercano a comprar su mercadería, luego se dirige a los asentamientos humanos y pueblos jóvenes donde realiza la venta de manera ambulatoria caminando  por las calles cargando su bandeja y ofreciendo de casa en casa durante toda la mañana. 
Se inició hace más de 2 años con un capital propio y hasta el momento lo viene realizando solo.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene sus productos pues es el principal alimento por las zonas donde vende.
Se decidió empezar éste negocio por la necesidad de contar con un oficio y obtener ingresos para sostener los gatos de su familia y por las tardes le queda tiempo libre para dedicarse a otras actividades.
Por otro lado, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene con su negocio, con las ganancias desea invertir en una bodega de venta de  abarrotes en su casa, donde atendería su pareja para así apoyarse mutuamente con los gastos del hogar, logrando brindar  una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que tendrá, que le servirá para avanzar con sus planes. Por otro lado, se siente a gusto con su banco comunal por el apoyo que viene recibiendo por parte de sus integrantes. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de su mercadería buscando otras variedades de pescados para surtir sus productos, además de realizar arreglos en su casa para implementar una bodega de venta de abarrotes, empezando con pocas cantidades.
texts.en:
Carlos, 55, is a hard-working and amiable person.  He is married to Graciela, who is a housewife and mother to their children, William and Clarita, who are 20 and 18 respectively. Together, they live in their own house, purchased with the fruits of their labor.  Carlos sells fresh fish.  He wakes up very early in the morning and drives to the closest port to buy his merchandise, then drives to the settlements and new towns, where he goes door to door with his tray selling his fish all morning.

He started this work more than two years ago, with his own money and has always worked alone. He considers his business very profitable because of the good income it gives him and the high demand for his products, since fish is the main food in the areas where he sells.

He decided to start this business because he needed a trade and a way to earn money to cover the costs of his family, while leaving his afternoons free to pursue other activities.

However, seeing how thriving his business has been, he now wants to invest his earnings in opening a grocery shop out of his home, where his wife can attend to the customers and they can work together to cover the household expenses, allowing them to give their children a better quality of life.  

This will be his third loan with Kiva partner MFP.   He is grateful for the financial support he will receive, which will help him to realize his plans.  He is also pleased with his community bank because of the support its members have given him.  With the $450, he will invest in buying merchandise, such as other varieties of fish to enhance his products.  He will also make changes to his house so that he can install a grocery store in it, which will open with a limited stock.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of fish, as well as refit his house to attach a shop to it.

loans.name: Hilma

texts.es:
Hilma, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer soñadora y entusiasta, con muchas ganas de progresar y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Está casada con Isaac quien se empleado  contando con ingreso fijo y padre de sus 3 hijos de 14, 7 y 3 años de edad a quienes quiere mucho. Juntos están cómodamente instados en su propia casa que construyeron con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. La actividad que realiza Hilma es la venta de productos de belleza femeninos como maquillajes, tintes, esmaltes, labiales, perfumes y otros. Todos estos productos son comprados por catálogo y vendidos desde su casa entre sus familiares, amistades y vecinos, también hace entregas a domicilio. Se diferencia el tarto amable y cordial que tiene con sus clientes quienes quedan satisfechos, y ellos la recomiendan con otras personas que con el tiempo se vuelven sus clientes habituales. Iniciándose hace más de 4 años, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola, tanto en la venta como en la cobranza de los créditos otorgados..
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la regular cliente que ha sabido ganarse. No tenía problema económicos antes de iniciar su negocio, pero se decidió aventurarse en su negocio para tener una ocupación en su tiempo libre y el desea de sentirse una prospera empresaria independiente. Ahora viendo los buenos resultados,  espera aumentar el stock de sus productos y ver crecer su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 7 con la institución MFP. Está contenta de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero para continuar con sus planes. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas amables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en compra de mercaderías para aumentar su  stock disponible para la venta, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, así tendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
42-year-old Hilma is an eager woman who dreams big.  She has a great desire to make progress and offer her family a better quality of life.  She is married to Isaac who is an employee and receives a regular income.  He is the father of her three children who are 14, 7 and 3 and who she loves very much.  They live together comfortably in their own home which they worked very hard to build.

Hilma's business is selling ladies' beauty products such as make-up, hair dyes, nail polish, lipsticks, perfumes, etc.  All of these products are bought through a catalog and sold from her home to family members, friends and neighbors.  She also provides home delivery.  Her business stands out because of the kind and friendly way in which she deals with her customers who end up satisfied and then recommend her to other people who, over time, become regular customers.  Hilma started this business more than four years ago and, up to now, she has worked alone both in selling her products and in collecting payment for them.

Hilma considers her business to be fairly profitable because of the good profits she makes and the regular customers that she has managed to attract.  She didn't have any financial problems before she started her business but she decided to take the plunge and start her own business so that she would have something to keep her busy in her free time, which would make her feel like a successful, independent businesswoman.  Seeing the good results she has experienced, Hilma now hopes to increase her stock and grow her business.

This will be Hilma's seventh loan from MFP.  She is happy to know that she will have the financial support she needs to continue carrying out her plans.  For her part, she pledges to be punctual in making her repayments as she has been with her previous loans.  She says that she feels happy with her community bank as she knows the members and considers them to be kind and supportive people.  Hilma will invest the 1,000 soles she has requested in buying merchandise so that she can increase the stock she has available for sale.  She will seek low prices because she is buying in bulk.  This will make her more profits.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics

loans.name: C8057 Ubufatanye Group

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is thirty-nine years old and is married with four children between the ages of three and ten. His business is well organized. He sells general goods such as tomato sauce, juice, salt, sugar and Irish potatoes. He works from 6am until 6pm every day and has three years of experience. Jean de Dieu employs two people to help him. 

Jean de Dieu has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products such as tomato sauce, juice, salt, sugar, Irish potatoes, etc to sell. With the profits, he will pay his children's school fees and renovate his own house.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as tomato sauce, juice, salt, sugar, and Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Kisaru

texts.en:
Kisaru is 56 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: C5696 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Dative is 52 years old and is married with two children between the ages 15 and 26 years old. She sells maize, sorghum and beans, and is open from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. She currently employs two people to help her.

She is the leader of the group, which is called "C5696 Abishyizehamwe" in the local language. She has one year of experience in this work. Dative has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more quantities of maize, sorghum, beans, etc., to sell.

With the profit, she expects to save money for medical insurance and to pay children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more quantities of maize, sorghum, beans, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rahat's Group

texts.en:
Rahat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s fruit selling business. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits of quality and in larger quantities.  

He is very hardworking and has been operating his business for many years. Rahat is confident that he will be even more successful with his business after the loan investment. 

Rahat is the mother of three sons and two daughters. Her youngest daughter stays at home while her remaining children work to contribute financially to the family. Rahat is a great mother and is putting a lot of effort into raising her children. She is also very good housewife and performs her duties very well.
She has confidence that her husband will be able to improve his business after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit for a fruit selling business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 29 years old and married with 2 children. She does maize farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years and has employed two people. She runs a retail shop to earn extra income.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: C9258 Dushyigikirane Group

texts.en:
Venantien is 33 years old and is married with two children between the ages 1 and 4 years old. Her business is well organized. In her small shop, she sells meat. She works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. Venantien employes one person to help her, and they have three years of experience.

Venantien is the president of this group, which is called "C9258 Dushyigikirane" in the local language. In the photo, she is on the right side. Venantien has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more quantities of meat to sell. With the profits from the loan, she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more quantities of meat to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jesyca, de 28 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene muchas ideas que desea realizar. Es conviviente con Luis quien es comerciante y padre de su hija de 2 años de edad y desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Juntos habitan su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Jesyca es la venta de bebidas gaseosas de diversos sabores  y marcas, para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora donde guarda sus productos a temperaturas heladas al gusto de sus clientes por lo caluroso de la zona. Atiende a sus clientes muy amablemente desde su casa. Iniciándose hace más de 02 años, comprando en pocas cantidades con su propio capital, y viendo la buena acogida que tuvo su negocio se decidió continuar y hasta el momento se dedica sola. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Antes tenía problemas económicos ya que los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanzaban y con la llegada de su hija los gastos aumentaron, tomando la decisión de iniciar su negocio, que ahora le saca de los apuros económicos.
Viendo los buenos resultados y la acogida que continúa teniendo su negocio tiene planes de aumentar el stock de sus mercaderías y así ver crecer su negocio y con las ganancias incursionar en otro negocio de carpintería en sociedad con su pareja que cuenta con los conocimientos necesarios para éste rubro. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Se siente contenta de saber que contará con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas para tener acceso a más créditos en el futuro. Además de gustarle el trabajo de su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo responsable  y unido. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en compra de más mercaderías para su negocio como bebidas gaseosas de diversos sabores, aumentando el stock disponible para la venta, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Jessica is 28 years old. She is a woman with a great desire to get ahead. She has many ideas to that she wants to make a reality. She lives with her partner Luis who is a merchant and the father of their two year old daughter. She wants to offer her a better quality of life. Together, they live in their own house that they bought with a lot of effort. Jessica’s business is selling different flavors and brands of soft drinks. She has a refrigerator where she keeps her products chilled for her customers due to the heat in the area. She serves her customers in a very friendly manner from her house. She started more than two years ago. She purchases products in small quantities with her own capital. And seeing the good reception she had with the business, she decided to continue and up until this time, she works alone. She considers the business to be quite profitable due to the good profits it provides. In the past, the couple had economic problems because they couldn’t manage with their earnings. With the arrival of their daughter, their expenses increased. With the decision to start her business, she is getting out of the economic tight spots. 

By seeing the good results and the reception she continues to have with her business, she has plans to expand her stock of merchandise to grow her business. With the profits, she wants to start another business, a carpenter’s workshop, with her partner who has the necessary skills for this business. This will be her second loan with MFP. She feels happy to know that she has a line of credit to grow her business. She promises to be responsible with the payments in order to have access to more loans in the future. In addition to liking the work of her communal bank, she considers the group to be responsible and united. With the requested loan of 1000 nuevos soles, she will invest the money in the purchase of more merchandise for her business like soft drinks in different flavors, in increasing the available stock for sale and in looking for better prices for wholesale sales.

loans.use: purchase more soft drinks.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, además es amable y sociable. Es conviviente con José quien es empleado y padre de sus 4 hijos: Lindolfo, Grecia, Julia y María de 19, 15, 11 y 3 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan cómodamente en su propia casa que compraron a base de esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Julia es la venta de bebidas gasificadas de varios sabores y diferentes marcas. La venta la realiza desde  su casa donde tiene una refrigeradora para guardar sus bebidas a temperatura helada al gusto de sus clientes por lo caluros de la zona, atendiéndolos de manera amable cordial y amena. 
Se inició hace más de 3 años contando con un capital propio, comprando y vendiendo en pequeñas cantidades, luego fue aumentando sus compras de acuerdo se incrementaba la demanda, y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola.  Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas guanacias que  le deja, además del consumo contante hace que rote su capital. Se decidió a empezar con su negocio pues vio como suben los precios de las cosa y los alimentos están cada vez más caros, eso hace que los ingresos de su pareja no les alcance, como madre vio ésta dificultad y se decidió a poyar a su pareja y poder sacar adelante a su familia.
Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, desea continuar con su negocio y incrementar el stock de sus productos y ver crecer su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Está contenta y agradecida de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para continuar con sus planes. Además se siente cómoda y le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de su mercadería en mayor cantidad para tener un stock disponible para la venta, buscando precios bajos por sus compras, de esa manera obtendrá mayores guanacias.
texts.en:
Julia, 38, is an industrious and enterprising woman who is driven to get ahead. She is also kind and friendly. She lives together with José who is employed and the father of their 4 children, Lindolfo, Grecia, Julia y María, ages 19, 15, 11 and 3 respectively. They live together comfortably in their own home that they purchased with much effort. 

Julia’s work is selling soda of different flavors and brands. She sells out of her house, and she has a refrigerator that keeps the drinks ice-cold, just the way her customers like them in the hot climate of the area. She tends to her customers with a friendly and pleasant manner. She started her business over three years ago using her own capital, buying and selling in small quantities. She continued to increase her purchases as demand increased. Now she continues working alone. She thinks her business is definitely worthwhile because of the good earnings it provides her. In addition, the constant consumption makes her capital keep turning over. 

Julia decided to start her business when she saw how the cost of consumer goods and food have continued to be more and more expensive, so much so that the income of her partner is no longer enough. As a mother, she took note of this difficulty and decided to support her partner and help her family get ahead. After seeing the good results that she has had, she wants to continue with her business and increase the amount of inventory to make the business grow. 

This will be her 4th loan with MFP. She feels both happy and thankful to have the financial support to continue with her plans. She likes and feels comfortable with her communal bank. She knows the members and considers them to be responsible people. With the 1200 Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, she will invest in a large quantity of merchandise to have more inventory available for sale. She will look for lower prices for her purchases so that she can have better earnings.

loans.use: purchase a variety of sodas

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Micaela es casada, tiene 48 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos 1 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la panadería, inicio siendo operaria y hasta el momento lle4va 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la tejeduría.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de harina, azúcar, ajonjolí, decorativos, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Micaela is 48 years old and married.  She did not have the opportunity to get an education.  She has six children; one of them goes to school.

She devotes herself to the bakery.  She started out as an operator, and she has ten years of experience.  She has her husband’s support; he is a weaver.

She is requesting the loan to buy flour, sugar, sesame, and decorative items, etc.  She hopes to have a prosperous business in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make bread.

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es:
Delicia, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y amable, además de ser trabajadora y decidida. Es conviviente con Jorge quien es comerciante. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo y en compañía de una sobrina que cuidan y apoyan con los gatos de sus estudios. La actividad que realiza Delicia es la venta de ropas de damas, caballeros y niños, siendo de diversos modelos y a la moda, estos productos se los envía una amiga desde la capital. También se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general,  contando con una bodega que acondicionó en su casa, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes y aprovecha en ofertarles las ropas que tiene disponible para la venta. Tiene más de 3 años dedicándose a ambos negocios, iniciándose con un capital propio y comprando en pequeñas cantidades, viendo los buenos resultados de decidió continuar, ahora ocasionalmente necesita el apoyo de una ayudante a quien paga por día trabajado. Considera a sus negocios bastante rentables por las ganancias que le deja. 
Se inició en ambos negocios debido a la necesidad de contar con una ocupación y apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar, además de poder sentirse una persona productiva e independiente. Viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de continuar y aumentar el stock de sus mercaderías, así verá crecer su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 7 con la institución MFP. Está contenta de saber que podrá tener acceso a una línea de crédito para continuar con su negocio, por tanto se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores, para tener un buen record crediticio y seguir contando con éste apoyo. Por otro lado, comenta que le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal pues los considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio como ropas variadas de diversos modelos, también abarrotes para surtir su bodega. Buscará precios más cómodos por el volumen de la compra de toda esa mercadería, así tendrá mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Delicia, 38, is cheerful and friendly, in addition to being determined and a hard worker. She lives together with Jorge who is a shopkeeper. They live together comfortably in their own home that they purchased with much effort. Their niece lives with them, and they help her with the expenses of her studies. 

Delicia sells clothes for women, men, and children. She has a variety of shapes and styles. The clothes are sent to her from the capital by a friend. She also sells general groceries. They have a grocery store set up in their house, where she kindly attends to her customers. She uses the opportunity to offer them clothes she has available for sale. She has done both businesses for over 3 years, starting out with her own capital and purchasing in small quantities. After seeing the good results, she decided to continue. Now she occasionally needs extra help from an assistant who she pays according to days worked. She thinks the businesses are definitely worth it because of the income they provide her. 

She started both businesses because of the need to have a job and support her partner with the household expenses. She also wanted to feel like a productive and independent person. Seeing the good results, she has plans to continue and increase the inventory of her merchandise, and this way, she can see her business grow. 

This will be her 7th loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she will have access to a line of credit to continue with her business. She promises to be punctual with the payment of her loan, just as in previous loans, in order to have a good credit record and continue to have this support. She says that she likes the work the bank does, and she considers it to be a united and supportive group. With the 1000 Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, she will invest in merchandise for her store, such as clothes of different designs, as well as groceries to stock her grocery store. She is looking to get lower prices by buying merchandise in volume, which will give her a better margin of profit.

loans.use: purchase clothes and products to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Angel Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Angel Alfredo es casado, tiene 30 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educacion primaria, tiene 1 hijos, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típico, inicio siendo operario y el apoyo de un familiar, hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, que se dedica a lo oficio domésticos.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de varios colores y clase, espera en el futuro tener un negocio mas grande, y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Angel Alfredo, 30, is married with one child and has four years of primary education. His occupation is weaving traditional cloth. He started being a worker and the assistant to a family member. Now he has 10 years of experience. He has the support of his wife who takes care of household work. 

Angel Alfredo is requesting the loan to purchase string of various colors and types. He hopes that in the future his business will be larger with better earnings.

loans.use: purchase string for weaving

loans.name: Mukhtaran's Group

texts.en:
Mukhtaran has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s vegetable-selling business. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables which will allow him to sell better quality fresh vegetables to his customers and increase his sales and profits. 

Mukhtaran is a seamstress, and sews clothes for clients from her community to make profit. She has got great sewing skills and receives regular orders from her clients due to her good quality work. She has given birth to a son and a daughter. Her son is a scrap dealer while her daughter stays at home.

Mukhtaran is very confident that her husband’s business will grow by making a loan investment and that this will allow her family to live better financial life.

Note: "In the photo, the lady holding a book (Called Asasah Passbook) is Mukhtaran."

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for a vegetable-selling business.

loans.name: Loum's Group

texts.en:
Loum is a forty-seven-year-old mother of five children, three of whom are under her responsibility. Currently, one of her dependent children is still in school while the rest are working for other people to get money to provide additional support to the family. Loum and her husband have been farming for many years using their one hectare of land to support the entire family and as the main source of income. To better feed the family, they also work on construction sites to earn extra income.

Loun joined VisionFund about six years ago and successfully repaid back all the loan. The loan has stabilized her family's condition and improved their living standards especially allowing them to have decent food and keep her rice farming business growing. Loun can earn about US$5 per day. As a result, she is requesting a new group loan with other three members. As the leader, she will use the KHR 1,000,000 loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland during this dry season farming. She hopes to earn more income to build a proper new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland during this dry season farming.

loans.name: Bouern's Group

texts.en:
As the breadwinner of the family, Bouern is a mother of three dependent children who are too young for schooling. To strive for her family, she has been farming a cornfield for seven years.

Bouern has been with VisionFund since 2009. She completely repaid back all the previous loan which has improved her living standards. Now she and her three other group members are requesting a new loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the group leader, she will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and to hire a laborer to plow her cornfield. She hopes that she will grow her corn quickly and that she will get a bigger yield during the peak season for corn demand which will mean she can earn more income.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to hire a laborer to plow her cornfield.

loans.name: Viateur

texts.en:
Viateur is fifty years old and is married with five children aged between six and sixteen. He owns a sewing business. This is his fifth year in this business.

Viateur has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his sewing business by buying various materials to use in his business. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To expand his sewing business by buying various materials.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is thirty-six years old and is married with four children aged between two and eight. He also take care of six relatives. Pascal owns a boutique selling various goods such as cooking oil, sugar, rice, salt, bread etc . This is his third year in this business and he currently employs one person to help him.

Pascal has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as: cooking oil, sugar, rice, salt, bread etc to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, pay school fees for his children and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods to sell such as cooking oil, sugar, rice, salt and bread.

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Thmor Kuol, is fifty-year-old Phorn, the mother of seven children. All her children are independent now. As villager, Phorn is also a rice farmer to make a living. Moreover, she also raises pigs to better feed the family.

Phorn joined VisionFund three years ago and completely repaid back the the loan which has helped her to grow her business gradually. She can earn about US$12 per day. Now she is applying a new loan of KHR 1,000,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland to help her to grow rice during this dry season. She hopes to earn more income and buy more material that will help her increase her crop yield such as a plowing machine and a water pump.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland to help her grow rice during this dry season.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 31 years old and is married with two children, between the ages of 2 and 5 years old. He owns a business selling clothes and shoes. This is his eighth year in the business and he currently employs two people to help him.

Jean de Dieu has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, pay school fees for his children and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Josee

texts.en:
Josee is thirty-five years old and is married with five children aged between four and fifteen. She sells fruits, vegetables, potatoes, bananas etc. This is her third year in this business.

Josee has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more fruits, vegetables, potatoes, bananas etc to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits, vegetables, potatoes and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia, de 26 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es conviviente con Juan quien se dedica al transporte y padre de sus 2 hijos de 7 y 1 años de edad. Juntos viven en  su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Patricia es la venta de frutas y refrescos, para eso cuenta con una mesa que instala todos los días por las mañanas en el frontis de su casa, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que son sus vecinos ganándose sus amistad. 
Se inició hace más de 2 años con un capital propio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana en la atención. Considera  su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene sus productos.
Se decidió empezar su negocio por necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar y así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos a quienes quiere mucho.
Por tanto, y viendo los buenos resultados que esta teniendo con su negocio, desea continuar y mantener su negocio.  Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de su mercadería necesaria para su negocio como las frutas frescas, buscando conseguir precios bajos por el volumen de sus compras.
texts.en:
Patricia, who is 26 years old, is a hard-working and determined woman with a great will to succeed. She lives with her partner, Juan, who works in transportation and is the father of their two children, ages 7 and 1. They live together in their own house, which they bought with great effort. Patricia's business is the sale of fruit and soft drinks. To do this, she sets up a table every morning in front of her house, where she cordially serves her customers, who are her neighbors, earning their friendship.

She began more than two years ago with some capital of her own, and up until now she has had the help of her sister in serving customers. She feels that her business is fairly profitable because of the earnings that it gives her and the demand for her products.

She decided to begin her business because of the need to have an income to assist her partner with the household expenses and thus be able to offer a better quality of life to their children, whom she loves very much.

Therefore, and seeing the good results she is having with her business, she wants to continue and maintain her business. This will be her second loan with MFP. For this she hopes for your assistance so that she can make her plans a reality. In addition, she is happy to be part of her communal bank because all the members are people who are responsible and very united. With the 1200 PEN that she has applied for, she will purchase the necessary merchandise for her business, such as fresh fruit, looking for low prices because of the volume of her purchases.

loans.use: to buy more fruit

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 49-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan, and the mother of four children.

Muna is looking to improve her family's life conditions so she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to to purchase furniture for her house and do home maintenance.

An aspiration of Muna is to build an additional floor for the house so that she can have her married children live with her.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her house and do home maintenance.

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en:
Originally from Pakistan, Zahid lives in Florida now, where he owns and manages two 7-11 convenience stores and gas stations. 

He opened his first location over four years ago due to the stability he saw in the 7-11 franchise and his urge to be a business owner. He was able to grow this location quickly and was able to open up a second location two years later in 2009. He now manages both locations including 16 full-time employees and six part-time employees. This is the aspect of his business that he is most proud of. He says that his biggest success is being able to employ many individuals and support the economy in this way. 

In the future, Zahid has aspirations to grow his business further with the hope of one day being able to open more locations. 

This loan is going to be used to improve both of his current locations with the installation of new, high-grade security systems.

loans.use: to purchase upgraded security.

loans.name: C 20004 Twegerane Group

texts.en:
Clemantine is twenty-five years old and is married with two children, a one and a three-year-old. She sells various goods such as sugar, bread, biscuits, Colgate etc. She is a leader of the group C 20004 TWEGERANE in the local language. In the photo, she is the one with the raised hand.  

Clemantine has four years experience in this business and the hours of her business are from 6 am to 5 pm every day except on Saturday.

Clemantine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as sugar, bread, biscuits, Colgate etc to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods to sell such as sugar, bread, biscuits and Colgate.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov is a mother who has three children under her responsibility as they are still in school. She is 33 years old and resides in a remote village of Ratanak Mondul, Battambang Province. She grows corn and also works for others for money to support the entire family. She has been doing these different jobs for fourteen years already.

Pov just joined VisionFund last year, in 2011. She successfully paid back the entire loan and has managed to improve her living standards and keep her children in school. Now she and her group consisting of other two members are requesting a new loan of KHR 1,000,000. As the group leader, she will use the entire loan to buy fertilizer and hire a laborer to plow her cornfield. She hopes that her corn will produce a bigger yield. As a result she will be able to earn more income and save some money to buy a motorbike to transport her corn to the market, and also to have a decent food.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire a laborer to plow her cornfield.

loans.name: Sreynuon

texts.en:
Sreynuon collects and sews used cement bags to create sacks for planting trees that she sells to local nurseries. Her husband is a construction worker and assists his wife when he is free. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy one more sewing machine and cement bags.

Sreynuon (pictured here) and her husband, Yom, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh City and they have three children: one son and two daughters. One is a construction worker and the other two are in school.

loans.use: to buy one more sewing machine and cement bags.

loans.name: Nuria

texts.en:
Originally from Cuba, Nuria came to the United States four years ago with her husband and son. The trip was not an easy one, but they were able to make it safely and settle in Florida, where they still live today. 

Once settled, she set out to study to be a physical therapist and was rewarded with a diploma. Last year she decided to found her own corporation in a bustling location within her community. Within this facility she set up a full-service rehabilitation center, including, a massage table, ultrasound machine, electrical stimulation machine, stretching table, etc. 

Nuria is capable of providing service to six clients a day at this fully equipped facility, depending on treatments. Nuria’s treatment is a specially designed two-part treatment – 40 sessions – where she provides a cold-heat treatment to repair damaged tissue and a second aspect that stretches and strengthens the muscles. 

Many of her clients use insurance for her services and these payments are sometimes heavily delayed. She is looking to get a loan to use as working capital to close this gap between treatment and payment from insurance companies.

loans.use: to improve her cash flow while waiting for insurance payments.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen supports her husband by preparing soda water. Her husband operates a shop in the market from where he sells soda water, which is a cold drink very popular among local community people.

Perveen is also a very good housewife. She stays at home and performs her household duties.

She has given birth to two sons and three daughters. Her eldest son supplies soda water to different shops while her other children are continuing their education.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy bottles and ingredients used in making soda water in larger quantity.

This will help him expand his business and increase his profits. He has been operating his business for many years and Perveen is very hopeful about the positive growth of his business after investing the loan.

loans.use: to buy bottles and ingredients for making and selling soda water cold drinks.

loans.name: Zahooran's Group

texts.en:
Zahooran is the mother of three sons and a daughter. Three of her children study and her younger son stays at home. She a housewife as well as working lady. Zahooran wakes up early in the morning to milk the cow and sell its milk to community members at a very reasonable rate. She and her husband provide very good milk which is why they have a good number of community clients. 

Zahooran is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her family's dairy business. Her husband will use her loan to buy a dairy cow to allow him to provide a larger quantity of milk to increase his sales and profit. Zahooran is confident that purchasing a dairy cow will positively improve her family's business and improve their financial life. In this photo, Zahooran is holding an Asasah passbook.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Rany is a young mother living in a rural village of the Ratanak Mondul district, Cambodia. She has two dependent children who are too young to attend school. For the past five years, Rany has made a living growing corn and running a stall where she sells vegetables, fish, and meat. She has received five previous loans from Vision Fund. She successfully repaid each loan and they helped her to buy food products and save money for her children's future education.

Rany is requesting a 1,400,000 KHR loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her cornfield and to buy additional grocery items for her stall such as canned food, soap, and instant noodles. She will share her loan with two other members who are requesting 1,400,000 and 1,200,000 KHR respectively. Rany hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and grocery items such as canned food, soap, and instant noodles to sell

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea, 52, is the mother of five children. Out of her five children, three children are working for others for pay.

To feed the family, she has been planting corn for ten years as the primary source of income and working for others for pay as additional income.

Sophea took her first loan with VisionFund in 2006 and successfully repaid all the loan. The loan has made her a better living and provided her a proper shelter and decent food. She now can earn almost US $8 per day. 

Therefore, she and her group member are confident in requesting a new loan of KHR 1,400,000 each. As the group leader, she will use the loan to buy seed and fertilizer for her corn field. She hopes to grow healthy corn for sale and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for the corn field.

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne is 30 years old and is married with one child who is 4 years old. He sells various goods such as biscuits, lotions, soap, clothes, etc. This is his second year in this business.

Etienne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as biscuits, lotions, soap, clothes, etc., to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as biscuits, lotions, soap, clothes, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 41 years old and has four children between 1 and 14 years old. 

He sells various goods such as cooking oil, juice, soap, lotions, toothpaste, etc., and he has three years' experience. Jean Damascene currently employs two people to help him.

Jean Damascene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase various goods such as cooking oil, juice, soap, lotions, toothpaste, etc., to sell. With any profits from the loan, Jean Damascene would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and start saving for his future.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as cooking oil, juice, soap, lotions, toothpaste, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Jeanne D`arc

texts.en:
Jeanne is 30 years old and is married. She sells various goods such as sugar, biscuits, soap, lotions, toothpaste, etc. This is her third years in this business.

Jeanne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as sugar, biscuits, soap, lotions, toothpaste, etc., to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as sugar, biscuits, soap, lotions, toothpaste, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon has been married since 1993 and she has three sons and two daughters. Two of her children are house contractors and the others attend school. Mon works as a weaver and her husband is a construction worker. In addition, Mon also raises pig at home. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Mon is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy neighboring land to expand her property. She will also use a part of her loan to assist her pig farming business by buying piglets and pig feed.

loans.use: to buy land to expand her property and to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Sam An

texts.en:
Sam An (in the photo) is a garment worker, while her husband, Sovannara is a construction worker. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh and have five daughters; one is a garment worker, two attend school and the others are still young.  

Sam An is asking for a loan to the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to get work because he commutes to work by bicycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to get to work.

loans.name: Sitho

texts.en:
Sitho (in the photo) is forty-two years old and so is her husband, Sareth. They live in a village outside Phnom Penh City. They have three children who are in school.   
 
Sitho stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s salary. He is a philosophy teacher. Sitho is asking for a loan to the amount of $600 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en:
Sophon (in the photo) and her husband, Nol, have been married since 1979 and have two sons and two daughters. Two of them are married and live in separate homes, one is a garment worker and another one is a fisherman. They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophon sells fish that her husband catches. Her husband is a fisherman. Sophon is applying for a loan of $800 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting. She will also use a part of the loan to build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting and build a restroom for family use.

loans.name: Kaneezan's Group

texts.en:
Kaneezan is the mother of six children, two of whom are studying while the others remain at home. Her husband is a farmer who grows different seasonal crops to earn a reasonably good profit. Kaneezan has a buffalo and she sells milk to community clients for a profit.

Kaneezan is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to purchase another buffalo for her dairy business. With her loan, she will be able to increase her milk productivity and earn more profit by selling larger quantities of milk. Kaneezan is very confident that with her loan investment, she will successfully be able to improve her business. She wants to provide an education for her children and she is confident that she will be able to do so by improving her business. In this photo, Kaneezan is holding an Asasah passbook.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Sam Aun

texts.en:
Sam Aun (in the photo), thirty-seven, and her husband, Borom, aged thirty-eight, live in a village about ten kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1998 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. 

Sam Aun sells dessert, while her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to get to work. Because the old motorbike breaks often, it is costly to repair and uses more gasoline than newer motorbikes.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for her husband to get to work.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene, de 29 años, es una muy buena mujer, amable y trabajadora, es conviviente con Arturo de 33 años y con quien tiene dos hijos, Liz de 5 y Brenda la menor recién nacida, vive en su casa propia en donde cría a sus hijas a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Marlene, consiste en la venta de frutas, todos los días se va al mercado de la ciudad en busca de las frutas mas frescas y nutritivas, compra al por mayor para de ahí ir a su casa en donde tiene un quiosco en el cual ofrece sus productos. A parte de ser la única que ofrece esa variedad de frutas, tiene un trato muy bueno y amable, eso hace que sus clientes vayan todos los días pues saben que encontraran las fruta que buscan y a un buen precio. Lleva realizando éste trabajo por 2 años aproximadamente, y lo hace sola.
Al principio, le fue muy difícil hacer su trabajo, pues el tener que madrugar le mortificaba mucho, pero con el tiempo aprendió a darse el tiempo por las tardes y así logra ganar tiempo por las mañanas. Le está yendo muy bien, tiene buenas ventas y eso le permite obtener buenas ganancias, espera seguir trabajando juntos y seguir progresando ya que cada día mejora la economía de su hogar, en un futuro desea tener una venta mas grande y poner a la venta mayor variedad de productos. Este será el crédito número cuatro con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además se compromete una vez mas a apagar sus cutas de manera puntual y muy responsables como en el crédito anterior que tuvo. Está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará mas frutas y aumentara con un poco de verduras, para que así pueda ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marlene, 29 years old, is a very good woman, friendly and hard-working. She lives with 33-year-old Arturo, with whom she has two children, 5-year-old Liz and her younger newborn, Brenda. She lives in her own house, where she raises her daughters and hopes to provide them with a better quality of life. Marlene's work consists of selling fruit. Every day she goes to the market in her city to look for the freshest and most nutritious fruits. She buys wholesale and from there goes to her house, where she has a stand to offer her products for sale. Besides being the only person who offers this variety of fruits, she also has a nice, friendly manner. Because of this, her customers come by every day, knowing they will find the fruit they're looking for at a good price. She has been doing this work for approximately two years, and she does it alone.

At first, it was very difficult for her to do this work, since having to get up in the early morning was very hard on her. With time, however, she learned to take time in the evenings in order to save herself time in the mornings. It is going very well for her. She has good sales, and that allows her to have good earnings. She hopes to continue working together and progressing, since her home finances are constantly improving. In the future she would like to increase her sales and offer a greater variety of products for sale. 

This will be her fourth loan with MFP, so she is hoping for a small loan to enable her to meet her goals. She is committed to once again making her payments in a very timely and responsible manner, as she did with the prior loan that she received. She is very happy to belong to her communal bank since all of the members are very good and supportive people. With the requested amount of 1200 soles, she will buy more fruit and increase the amount a vegetables a bit, allowing her to offer greater variety to her clients.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Carina

texts.es:
Carina, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y amable tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está casada con Rolando  quien es empleado y padre de sus 2 hijos de 15 y 5 años de edad deseando brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa que compraron son el fruto de sus ahorros de varios años. La actividad que realza  Carina es la venta de comida como desayunos, menús y platos extras de la amazonia. Todos estos alimentos los prepara en su local acondicionado en su propia casa, y los vende a su distinguida clientela qua a diario la visitan, brindándoles un trato amable y cordial. También ese local lo alquila para recepciones y eventos sociales.  Iniciándose hace más de 2 años con un capital y realizando compras pequeñas, pero viendo la buena acogida fueron aumentando poco a poco, ganándose la preferencia de sus clientes y ahora necesita contar con el apoyo de algunos ayudantes a quienes paga por semana.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tienen sus platillos. Antes de tener este negocio no tenía problemas, pero se decidió iniciarlo para tener una ocupación, sentirse una persona productiva y una prospera empresaria e independiente. Ahora  viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de ampliar su local para aumentar la capacidad de personas. Así brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este será el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP. Se siente contenta de saber que contara con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por tanto se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal, por el apoyo a las personas con el acceso a líneas de créditos.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor para la preparación de sus diversos platillos, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen, así tendrá mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Carina, age 37, is a hard-working and enterprising woman.  In addition to being cheerful and kind, she has a great desire to get ahead.  She is married to Roland, and he is employed.  They have two children, ages 15 and 5.  They wish to give their children a better quality of life.  They live comfortably together in their own house, which they bought with their savings from several years.

Carina sells food like breakfasts, a daily menu, and extra dishes from the Amazon.  She prepares all of this food in a space that has been set up in her own house.  She sells her food to the distinguished customers who visit her daily.  She treats them kindly and cordially.  She also rents this place for receptions and social events.  She started over two years ago with some capital and by making some small purchases.  However, upon seeing the good acceptance, the business gradually increased as it was becoming the favorite of her customers.  Now she has assistance from helpers, whom she pays weekly.

She believes that her business is pretty profitable because of the good income it gives her, and there is a demand for her dishes.  She had no problems before she had this business.  She decided to start it in order to have an occupation and to feel like a productive person, a prosperous business person, and to be independent.  Now, seeing the good results, she has plans to expand her place in order to increase the capacity for customers.  This way she will make her customers more comfortable.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she can count on financial support to advance with her business.  She pledges once more to make her payments as she did with her previous loans.  Also, she likes working with her communal bank because of the support it gives people and the access to lines of credit.

She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy wholesale ingredients to make her diverse dishes.  She will look for better prices by purchasing in volume.  That way she will have a greater profit margin.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene, de 58 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de progresar. Es conviviente con Richard quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de su único hijo de 13 años de edad. Juntos ha bitan cómodamente su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Irene es la venta de bebidas gasificadas de diversos sabores y marcas para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora donde pone a helar al gusto de sus clientes por el clima caluroso de la zona. También oferta tortas que ella prepara en casa, receta que aprendió de su mamá. Ambos productos los oferta a diario desde su casa, donde atiende muy amable y cordialmente a sus clientes que son en su mayoría sus propios vecinos y transeúntes de la zona, logrando tener bastante acogida. Tiene más de 1 año dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento lo realiza sola o en ocasiones atiende su hijo.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene, ya que ésta zona es bastante calurosa por tanto tiene bastante salida las bebidas gaseosas, dejándole buenas ganancias.
No tenía problemas económicos, antes de tener su negocio, pero decidió iniciar para poder sentirse ocupada y una personas productiva, además de poder estar en casa y cuidar de su hijo. Viendo los buenos resultados, espera crecer más su negocio, aumentar el stock de sus productos y con las ganancias seguir reinvirtiendo. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Se siente contenta de saber que contará con una ayuda financiera para continuar con sus planes en su negocio. Por tanto se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores, así tener un buen récord crediticio. Además comenta gustarle el trabajo de su banco comunal ya que apoyan a las personas más necesitadas con acceso a una línea de crédito. Con el préstamo solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de un motor nuevo valorizado en 900 nuevos soles para una unidad de transporte que tiene paralizado en su casa, así busca generarse más ingresos económicos  y con el saldo comprará bebidas gasificadas a precio por mayor para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Irene, 58, is an enterprising and hardworking woman who is driven to get ahead. She lives with her partner Richard who works in transportation. He is the father of their only son who is 13 years old. Together they live in their own house that they bought with a lot of effort. 

Irene sells sodas of various flavors and brands. She has a refrigerater where she keeps the drinks cool, just the way her clients like it in the hot climate of the area. She also offers cakes for sale that she makes at home using her mother’s recipe. She offers both products for sale from her home every day, where she attends to her clients with a friendly and kind manner. The majority of her customers are neighbors or passer bys in the area, and they are all well received. She has worked in this business for over a year. She normally works alone, but sometimes her son helps her. She considers her business to be profitable because of the demand that she has. The area is very hot so she sells a lot of soda, giving her good earnings. 

She did not have specific economic problems before starting her business, but she decided to start it to feel like a productive, busy person, as well as to be able to be at home and care for her son. Seeing the good results, she hopes for her business to grow. She wants to increase the stock of her products and use the earnings to continue reinvesting. This will be her 4th loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she will have the financial support to continue with plans for her business. She commits to being punctual with the payments of her loan, just like in previous loans, to have a good credit record. She says that she likes the work the bank does because it gives the people that most need it a line of credit. 

With the loan of 1500 Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, she plans to invest in a new engine, valued at 900 Nuevos Soles, for a transportation unit that is at the house paralyzed. With the new engine, she is looking to earn more of an income. With the rest of the funds, she will purchase wholesale sodas to stock her store.

loans.use: purchase more soda and an engine for a motorcycle taxi to generate more income

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda is 50 years old and married with three children. Sevda has bred cattle and cows for the last 10 years. She was a housewife and her husband was unemployed when Sevda decided to purchase her first cow.
 
Sevda usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then sells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 150 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income in her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Sevda also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

She wants to expand her business and improve life conditions of her family. She applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase one head of cattle, one milk cow and fodder.

loans.use: to buy one head of cattle, one milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mon is 54 years old and his wife, Kim, is 54 years old (pictured together). They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh city and they have six children: four sons and two daughters. Two are married and live in separate homes, two are garment workers, one is a construction worker and another attends school. Mon is a mason. His wife stays at home. He is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,200 to rebuild the house where he lives.

loans.use: to rebuild the house where he lives.

loans.name: Vasila

texts.en:
Vasila is 53 years old and married with three children. She is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has about 10 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person in this field. 

Vasila usually sells her crops in the central bazaar. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made with vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in the Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch. Vasila's monthly income is 300 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and working in the open air, which is very hard for a woman and that is why her husband helps Vasila. 

She needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase monthly turnover. For this purpose, she applied for 1,300 AZN.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Narath, live on an island located 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2002 and have two children- one son and one daughter. 

Sinat is a weaver, while her husband is a motor taxi driver. His motor taxi is old and often broken, so he spends a lot of money to repair it. Hence, Sinat decides to apply for a loan of 1,000 USD to help her husband by purchasing the new motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Thim

texts.en: Thim is 32 years old and her husband, Sopheap, is 35 years old. Thim and her husband are rice farmers. They live in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh city. In the photo, Thim is at home; not at the farm. They have been married since 1998 and have four children who attend school: two sons and two daughters. Thim is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Mammad

texts.en:
Mammad is 56 years old, married and has two sons. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 3 years. During these years, Mammad gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made with vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in the Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch. Mammad usually sells his crops in the central bazaar and his son helps him. His monthly income is 300 AZN.

As his products are in high demand, Mammad wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1,500 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his 4th loan and he has positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is 34 years old and her husband, Sarom, is 33 years old. They live in a village about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1998 and have three children- one son and two daughters. Two of the children attend school and another one is still young.   

Phalla and her husband are farmers; they grow flowers, bananas and papayas. Phalla is applying for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm. She will also use a part of the loan to buy water pumping machine to spray her farm.   

Photo: Phalla is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm and buy a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Philippe

texts.en:
Philippe is 28 years old and is married with one child who is one year old, and he takes care of three relatives. He owns a boutique selling various goods such as biscuits, water, pens, juice, sugar, etc. This is his second year in this business.

Philippe has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods to sell, such as biscuits, water, pens, juice, sugar, etc. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, to pay school fees for his children and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods to sell, such as biscuits, water, pens, juice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Elith

texts.es: Elith, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante y triunfar en la vida. Está casada con Carlos quien se dedica al transporte y es el padre de sus 06 hijos de 18, 17 8 años de edad y 3 trillizos de 3 años de edad, con quienes habita una casa alquilada y los quiere mucho y son su motivación para trabajar más buscando brindarles una mejor calida de vida. La actividad que realiza Elith es la venta de fármacos y demás productos de salud, para eso cuenta con una botica que abrió en un local alquilado en el mismo lugar que tiene alquilada su vivienda, ahorrándose más gastos de alquiler. Se inicio con su negocio hace más de 01 año y contando con el apoyo de su esposo quien le apoyó con el capital que le faltaba para  comprar la mercadería necearía, viendo que al frente está ubicada una posta de salud donde muchas veces no cuentan con los medicamentos solicitado  por los pacientes. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la regular clientela que tiene.  Antes de tener su negocio, se encontraba en apuros económicos, ya que su familia crecía de manera muy rápida con la llegada de sus trillizos y los gastos crecieron,  ya no les alcanzaba con sus ingresos, buscando alternativas de solución, se decidieron por ese negocio, que ahora les va bien y les ha sacado de muchos apuros económicos. Por tanto, tienen planes de continuar y hacerlo crecer adquiriendo más mercaderías para así tener un stock disponible para la venta. Este será el préstamo número 07 con la institución MFP. Esta muy contenta de saber que contará con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a cumplir  con el pago de sus cuotas y tener un buen record crediticio para en el futuro tener acceso a más créditos. Por otro lado, comenta que se siente a gusto con el trabajo de su banco comunal por el apoyo que viene brindando a las personas que lo necesitan. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de productos de farmacia como medicamentos, pastillas, y otros, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen y así brindar precios más bajos a sus clientes apoyándoles en sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Elith, age 34, is a hard-working and diligent woman.  She has a great desire to get ahead and to triumph in life.  She is married to Carlos, a transportation worker, and he is the father of their six children.  The children are ages 18, 17, 8, and 3 year old triplets.  They live together in a rented house.
